;;世界新闻摄影展的照片之一，该展览在匈牙利已不对 18 岁以下青少年开放。
;

;匈牙利右翼民粹主义政府认定其部分照片违反了限制 LGBTQ+ 内容的有争议的法律，因此禁止 18 岁以下的人参观今年在布达佩斯举行的世界新闻摄影展。

;

;这一享有盛誉的展览在布达佩斯的匈牙利国家博物馆展出，每年接待来自世界各地的超过四百万参观者。其使命是展示杰出的新闻摄影，为全球观众提供一系列重要事件的视觉报道。

;

;菲律宾摄影记者汉娜·雷耶斯·莫拉莱斯 (Hannah Reyes Morales) 拍摄的一组五张照片促使一位极右翼匈牙利议员提交了文件向文化部提出投诉，文化部发现他们违反了匈牙利禁止向未成年人展示 LGBTQ+ 内容的法律。现在，即使得到父母的同意，18岁以下的人也不再被允许参观展览。

;
;

;;相关：;;卢森堡首相的同性丈夫在峰会上坐在维克托·欧尔班旁边;

;
;

;这些照片记录了菲律宾一个由 LGBTQ+ 老人组成的社区，他们几十年来一直住在一个家中，随着年龄的增长互相照顾，一些社区成员穿着变装、化着妆。

;

;世界新闻摄影执行董事 Joumana El Zein Khoury 表示，“如此积极、如此包容”的照片系列遭到匈牙利政府的攻击，这令人担忧。她说，这是第一次其中一个展览在欧洲面临审查。

;

;“事实上，特定类型的观众的参观受到限制，这确实让我们感到非常震惊，”Khoury说。 “令人难以置信的是，这个特定的图像、这个特定的故事，而且令人难以置信的是它发生在欧洲。”

;

;Tamas Revesz，前世界新闻摄影评审团成员，一直是该活动的组织者。匈牙利举办了三十多年的展览，他表示，展览中的许多照片——例如对乌克兰战争的报道——比莫拉莱斯的系列“严肃和令人震惊一千倍”。

;

;考虑到这一点他说，每年在匈牙利参观展览的大约 5 万人中，有一半是学生，成千上万的匈牙利年轻人将无法观看该藏品，即使是那些不包含 LGBTQ+ 内容的图像。

;
;

; ;相关：;;《卫报》对维克多·欧尔班的布鲁塞尔抨击的看法：清算必须到来 |社论;

;
;

;禁止年轻人参观展览的举措是匈牙利政府（由民族主义总理维克托·欧尔班领导）的最新举措，旨在限制宣传材料的供应。或在媒体（包括电视、电影、广告和文学）中向未成年人描述同性恋。

;

;虽然政府坚称 2021 年《儿童保护》法旨在使儿童免受所谓的性宣传，但它此举引发了欧盟 15 个国家的法律诉讼，欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉·冯德莱恩 (Ursula von der Leyen) 称其为“耻辱”。

;

;摄影师雷耶斯·莫拉莱斯 (Reyes Morales) 在一份电子邮件声明中表示，这些拍摄对象她的照片是菲律宾 LGBTQ+ 人群的“偶像和榜样”，并且它们“不危险或有害”。

;

;匈牙利文化部没有回应采访请求。

;;首尔地铁乘客
;

;首尔地铁系统计划引入无座位车厢列车其运营商宣布，为了缓解高峰时段的拥堵。

;

;该试点计划将于 1 月开始，将涉及在韩国首都两座城市运行的地铁列车上拆除两节车厢的座位。首尔地铁周三表示，早晚高峰时段有 9 条主要线路。它是一个更广泛项目的一部分，旨在减少世界上最繁忙的地铁系统之一的拥堵;.

;

;据首尔地铁称，到 2023 年第三季度，正在进行试验的 4 号线和 7 号线内部的拥堵程度分别达到了运力的 193.4% 和 164.2% ，在最繁忙的时间。随着座位的拆除，预计每节地铁车厢的高峰拥堵程度将降至 4 号线的 153.4% 和 7 号线的 130.1%。

;
;

;;相关：;;首尔的秘密空间：广阔的神秘隧道首次揭晓;

;
;

;首尔地铁; ; 管理着世界上最大的城市铁路网络之一，包括 9 条线路和 275 个车站，每天为大约 700 万名通勤者提供服务。

;

;“如果试点项目证明有效，我们将在首尔地铁首席执行官白浩 (Baek Ho) 表示：“未来，确保市民能够更舒适、安全地使用地铁。”

;

;除此消息外，首尔地铁还增加了高峰时段两条拥堵线路上的地铁列车班次。一些当地媒体询问该举措是否最终会结束令人恐惧的“jiokcheol”，这是一个结合了“地狱”和“地铁”的术语它捕捉到了乘客在过度拥挤的地铁列车上每天所经历的挫败感。

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 14:22:02 +0800 Air pollution raises risk of type 2 diabetes, says landmark Indian studyhttps://www.theguardian.com/global-development/2023/nov/01/air-pollution-raises-risk-of-type-2-diabetes-says-landmark-indian-study-acc
;;2023-11-01T06:00:32Z;
;
;;新德里的雾霾中，人们走在通往印度门的路上。印度是世界上空气污染最严重的国家之一。
;

;印度第一项此类研究发现，吸入受污染的空气会增加患 2 型糖尿病的风险。在德里和南部城市金奈进行的研究发现，吸入含有大量 PM2.5 颗粒的空气会导致高血糖并增加 2 型糖尿病发病率。

;

;吸入时，PM2.5 颗粒 –它们比一根头发丝细 30 倍，可以进入血液并导致多种呼吸系统和心血管疾病。

;

;;这项研究;是 2010 年开始的印度慢性病研究的一部分。它是第一个关注环境 PM2.5 暴露与 2 型疾病之间联系的研究印度是;世界上空气污染最严重的国家;之一。

; ;

;德里的 PM2.5 年均浓度为 82-100μg/m;3;，钦奈为 30-40μg/m; m;3;，根据研究，; ;多次;世界卫生组织限制为 5μg/m;3;;。 ;印度国家空气质量标准;为 40μg/m;3;。

;

;非传染性疾病也有;高负担; ，包括印度的糖尿病、高血压和心脏病；根据 ;论文;6月发表在《柳叶刀》上。 ;欧盟的平均糖尿病患病率; 2019 年为 6.2%，2016 年英国;为 8.6%。; p>;

;《柳叶刀》研究发现印度的糖尿病患病率高于之前的估计，并且印度城市中的糖尿病患者数量高于农村。

; ;

;在 BMJ 的研究中，研究人员从 2010 年到 2017 年跟踪了德里和金奈的 12,000 名男性和女性，并测量了他们的血糖水平定期。利用卫星数据和空气污染暴露模型，他们确定了该时间范围内每位参与者所在地区的空气污染情况。

;

;他们发现，接触 PM2.5 一个月会导致血糖水平升高，长期接触一年或更长时间会导致患糖尿病的风险增加。他们发现，这两个城市的 PM2.5 年均水平每增加 10μg/m;3;，患糖尿病的风险就会增加 22%。

;
;

;;相关：;;全球调查发现 40% 的病例未确诊糖尿病;

;
;

;“鉴于印度人的病理生理学特征——BMI 低且脂肪比例高——我们更容易患糖尿病该研究的首席研究员、德里慢性病控制中心的研究员 Siddhartha Mandal 说道。

;

;空气污染（一种环境因素）随着过去生活方式的改变而增加他说，20 到 30 年来，糖尿病负担不断加重。

;

;“到目前为止，我们一直认为饮食、肥胖和体育锻炼是解释印度城市居民糖尿病患病率较高的一些因素马德拉斯糖尿病研究基金会主席、该论文的作者之一 V Mohan 博士说： “这项研究令人大开眼界，因为现在我们发现了导致糖尿病的新原因，那就是污染。”

; ;

;另一个;对德里同一人群的研究;发现德里每年平均接触 PM2.5 (92μg/m;3 ;）导致血压水平升高，并增加患高血压的可能性。

;

;研究表明，印度城市空气中 PM2.5 高于安全水平会导致糖尿病和Mandal 表示，高血压可能导致动脉粥样硬化（动脉中脂肪沉积）、心脏病发作和心力衰竭。

;

;PM2.5 含有硫酸盐、硝酸盐、重金属和黑碳，会损害人体健康。血管内壁并通过使动脉硬化而升高血压。心脏病专家、慢性病控制中心执行主任、该论文的作者之一 Dorairaj Prabhakaran 博士说，这些颗粒可以沉积在脂肪细胞中并引起炎症，还可以直接攻击心肌。

;

;作为一种内分泌干扰物，PM2.5 会阻碍体内胰岛素的产生及其作用。

;

;在印度城市，甲状腺功能减退症、多囊卵巢综合征 (PCOS) 和妊娠期女性患病率有所上升。糖尿病。 Mohan 表示，这项研究表明，污染可能是导致所有这些问题的原因之一，因为它会扰乱体内产生所有激素的内分泌系统。

; ;

;研究人员目前正在努力了解污染对体内胆固醇和维生素D水平的影响，及其对个体生命周期的影响，包括出生体重、孕妇健康、青少年胰岛素抵抗，以及帕金森氏症和阿尔茨海默氏症等疾病的风险。

;

;虽然其发现令人震惊，但这项研究给科学家带来了希望，减少污染可以减轻糖尿病以及其他非传染性疾病的负担”，普拉巴卡兰说。

;

;一些公共政策举措已初见成效。自 2016 年公众对空气污染提出强烈抗议以来，中央和德里政府禁止使用老式柴油车辆，限制建设，修建绕过城市的高速公路，并禁止焚烧农作物。报告显示，2016 年至 2021 年间，PM2.5 水平下降了 22%。

;

;“这是一个适度但值得欢迎的下降。全国各地都迫切需要因地制宜采取类似措施。”普拉巴卡兰说。

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 13:52:02 +0800 Cigarette-style climate warnings on food could cut meat consumption, study suggestshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/01/cigarette-style-climate-warnings-on-food-could-cut-meat-consumption-study-suggests
;;2023-11-01T05:00:32Z;
;
;;牙签上有警告的汉堡，上面写着：“警告：吃肉会导致气候变化。”;

;人们习惯于看到烟草产品上的严厉警告，提醒他们潜在的致命健康风险。现在，一项研究表明，食品上的类似标签不仅可以帮助他们在健康方面做出更明智的选择，而且可以帮助他们对地球的健康做出更明智的选择。

;

;达勒姆大学学者的研究发现，包含图形的警告标签图像 - 类似于烟盒上有关阳痿、心脏病或肺癌的警告 - 可以减少 7-10% 的含肉膳食选择。

;

;这一变化可能会对人类健康产生重大影响。地球的未来。根据最近的 YouGov 民意调查，72% 的英国人将自己归类为肉食者。但就净零目标向政府提供建议的气候变化委员会 (CCC) 表示，为了实现这些目标，英国需要到 2030 年将肉类消费量削减 20%，到 2050 年削减 50%。

;

;领导达勒姆研究的博士生杰克·休斯 (Jack Hughes) 表示：“当你将 [CCC 建议] 与高肉类摄入量与许多健康问题相关的事实以及我们目前的耕种方式结合起来时，或者当然一些最常见的农业方式也与流行病爆发的可能性密切相关，很明显，有多种原因可以解释为什么我们目前吃肉的方式可能不是最好的方式。”

;
;

;;相关：;;揭秘：支持肉食的“科学家宣言”背后的行业人物;

;
;

;Hughes 和同事将 1,001 名肉食成年人分为四组，并向每组展示了热肉、鱼、素食和纯素食堂式餐点的照片 - 从汉堡到乳蛋饼 - 带有健康警告标签、气候警告标签、流行病警告标签或根本没有标签。< /p>;

;事实证明，流行病警告最有效地阻止参与者吃肉类，使他们的选择减少了 10%，其次是健康警告，占 8.8%，然后是气候警告，占 7.4%，但研究人员表示，差异在于在统计上不显着，并且参与者认为气候警告是最可信的。

;

;研究人员相信他们的发现有助于鼓励人们改变美食选择，最终有利于环境。 “实现净零排放是国家和地球的首要任务，”休斯说。 “由于警告标签已被证明可以减少吸烟以及含糖饮料和酒精的饮用，如果将警告标签作为国家政策引入，在含肉产品上使用警告标签可以帮助我们实现这一目标。”

;

;研究发表在《食欲》杂志上。

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 13:52:02 +0800 Baltic Sea faces ‘critical challenges’ on climate and biodiversity, report warnshttps://www.theguardian.com/environment/2023/nov/01/baltic-sea-faces-critical-challenges-climate-biodiversity-report
;;2023-11-01T05:00:32Z;
;
;;人们清理岸边岩石中的石油
;

;波罗的海面临“危急”一份报告称，瑞典海岸警卫队正在努力遏制该国南部海岸漏油事件的影响，因此“面临着气候危机和生物多样性退化带来的挑战”。

;

;在同类中最全面的审计中迄今为止，波罗的海海洋环境保护委员会 (Helcom) 的专家周二表示，2016 年至 2021 年间，水体健康状况“几乎没有改善”。

;

;鱼类种群数量为报告称，水位处于危险的低水平，而污染、土地使用和资源开采继续给海洋带来压力。

;
;

;;相关：;;瑞典当局努力稳定遭受漏油袭击的渡轮进入波罗的海;

;
;

;周一，瑞典海岸警卫队从波罗的海提取了约 20 立方米石油，在 ;渡轮搁浅三次; 瑞典南部霍尔维克附近。

;

;海岸警卫队周二表示，希望“马可波罗”号能够在周三被打捞并运往卡尔斯港的一个港口，以防止进一步漏油的风险。

;

;波罗的海周围环绕着瑞典、芬兰、丹麦和俄罗斯等九个国家，相对较浅、低盐度、微咸的封闭水域使其具有独特的海洋环境。这些特性也意味着它特别容易受到污染和不断变化的环境条件的影响。

;

;《2023 年波罗的海状况》报告发现，尽管努力改善环境，但总体状况并未改善，一些指标还恶化。赫尔辛基委员会副执行秘书兼报告协调员贾尼卡·哈尔丁 (Jannica Haldin) 表示：“调查结果发人深省，提醒人们波罗的海面临着人类活动带来的严峻挑战。跨界合作、转向真正环境可持续的做法和长期承诺的重要性怎么强调都不为过。”

;

;包括污染、过度捕捞和栖息地破坏在内的人类活动影响了生态系统，导致生态系统整体下降。报告发现，生物多样性。

;

;富营养化——一种主要是人为现象，氮和磷等营养物质过量导致藻类大量繁殖——也是一个问题。

;

;报告称。报告发现，波罗的海恶劣的环境状况也影响了渔业和旅游业的盈利能力。

;

;有一些亮点。人们发现，减少营养物质投入和有害物质以及生物多样性和保护方面的工作在波罗的海的一些地区显示出成功的迹象，并且一些以前的污染热点已从最新的评估中删除。该地区海洋保护区的比例正在增加。

;

;但报告称，气候危机造成的损失越来越大，导致冰盖减少、极端天气增多和水温上升。

;

;Helcom 于 2021 年制定的波罗的海行动计划呼吁加强生物多样性、减少环境压力以及改善波罗的海生态系统的整体健康状况。

;

;“仍然，目前的评估结果表明，当今生物多样性的恢复速度太慢，”哈尔丁说。 “本报告中提出的恶化状况与我们作为一个社会的活动和优先事项直接相关。”

;

;她补充道：“确保波罗的海生态系统维持和改善其功能完全取决于如何我们可以管理我们的活动，以确保它们真正可持续，并增强生态系统的弹性，无论是在不久的将来还是长期。”

;

;A US jury on Tuesday found the National Association of Realtors (NAR) and some residential brokerages, including units of Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway, liable to pay $1.78bn in damages for conspiring to artificially inflate commissions for home sales.

;

;The verdict by a federal jury in Kansas City, Missouri, could upend decades-old practices that have allowed real estate agents to boost commissions as home prices and mortgage rates rise, hurting consumers by making housing transactions more expensive.

;

;Plaintiffs in the class action included sellers of more than 260,000 homes in Missouri, Kansas and Illinois between 2015 and 2022, who objected to the commissions they were obligated to pay buyers' brokers.

;
;

;;Related: ;;US banking crisis: Warren Buffett says bosses should face 'punishment';

;
;

;The verdict followed a two-week trial, and the damages award can be tripled under US antitrust law to more than $5.3bn.

;

;“Today was a day of accountability,” said Michael Ketchmark, the lead lawyer for the plaintiffs.

;

;The defendants included Berkshire-owned HomeServices of America and two subsidiaries, as well as the real estate franchise Keller Williams.

;

;NAR spokesperson Mantill Williams said the trade group plans to appeal, and seek reduced damages.

;

;HomeServices said it was disappointed in the verdict and planned to appeal, while Keller Williams spokesperson Darryl Frost said the realty company would consider its options for an appeal. “This is not the end,” Frost said.

;

;Broker compensation in the US has typically been about 5% to 6% of a home's sale price, with about half paid to a buyer's broker.

;

;Home sellers complained that this model suppressed competition by keeping commissions for buyer brokers in the 2.5% to 3% range despite the brokers' diminishing role, with many buyers able to find homes independently online.

;

;Sellers said the arrangement had “severe anticompetitive effects” and made “no economic sense, except for the buyer broker”.

;

;The defendants denied wrongdoing, with the NAR saying there was no evidence agents were required to “make offers of compensation at all, let alone at amounts that stabilize, fix or raise commissions”.

;

;Re/Max and Anywhere Real Estate, whose brands include Century 21, Coldwell Banker and Corcoran, had been defendants but settled before trial, with Re/Max paying $55m and Anywhere paying $83.5m, without admitting liability.

;

;Shares of real estate brokerages not involved in the verdict closed lower.

;

;Re/Max fell 4.4% and Anywhere fell 2.7%, while online brokers Zillow Group and Redfin declined 6.9% and 5.7%, respectively.

;

;The US Department of Justice is separately asking a federal appeals court in Washington to let it revive an antitrust probe into the NAR's practices.

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 08:52:02 +0800 Nick Clegg compares AI clamour to ‘moral panic’ in 80s over video gameshttps://www.theguardian.com/technology/2023/nov/01/nick-clegg-ai-clamour-similar-moral-panic-video-games
;;2023-11-01T00:01:25Z;
;
;;Nick Clegg speaks during a press conference at the Meta showroom in Brussels in 2022.
;

;Nick Clegg has compared the clamour over artificial intelligence to the 80s-era “moral panic” over video games, firing a warning shot to international politicians and regulators as they gather for a two-day summit on AI safety.

;

;The former UK deputy prime minister who is now president of global affairs at Mark Zuckerberg's Meta said AI was caught in a “great hype cycle” but warned that new technologies inspired a mixture of excessive zeal and excessive pessimism.

;

;British officials are hoping to use the ;summit, which starts on Wednesday at Bletchley Park;, to kickstart a regulatory process that could mirror international attempts to combat the climate crisis. But Clegg's comments show they are likely to encounter resistance from some of the industry's most powerful companies.

;
;

;;Related: ;;AI risk must be treated as seriously as climate crisis, says Google DeepMind chief;

;
;

;“New technologies always lead to hype,” he said. “They often lead to excessive zeal amongst the advocates and excessive pessimism amongst the critics.

;

;“I remember the 80s.人们对电子游戏产生了道德恐慌。 There were moral panics about radio, the bicycle, the internet.”

;

;Referring to predictions that a highly powerful form of AI could emerge within years with revolutionary consequences, he added: “These predictions about what's going to happen next, what's going to happen just around the corner, often doesn't quite turn out as those who are most steeped in it believe.”

;

;Clegg is one of the most powerful executives attending the summit this week. Others include Elon Musk, who will use his X social media platform ;to hold a conversation; about regulating AI with Rishi Sunak, the UK prime minister, on Thursday evening.

;

;Ursula von der Leyen, the president of the European Commission, will be one of the most high-profile international politicians in attendance. Others including the US president, Joe Biden, and the French president, Emmanuel Macron, have decided to stay away.

;

;Some believe the summit should focus on short-term risks, such as biased decision-making and the potential to use AI for election disinformation. Clegg said he wanted delegates to discuss how to watermark AI-made content in a “collaborative way”.

;

;But much of the conversation this week will focus on longer-term risks, including the potential for an artificial general intelligence system to evade human control, with many experts warning that a sufficiently advanced system could even pose a threat to humanity itself.

;

;Stuart Russell, a professor of computer science at University of California, Berkeley, who is attending the summit, warned on Tuesday the current approach to building AI systems was unsafe.

;

;“We need to stop thinking about making AI safe, and start thinking about making safe AI,” he said. “We build the AI and then we have a safety team to stop it from behaving badly – that hasn't worked and it's never going to work.”

;

;Connor Leahy, the chief executive of the AI safety research company Conjecture, who will also be at the summit, called for an end to allowing privately owned AI companies to build “deadly machines” that he says will take control of the future.

;

;He said: “There is nothing more important than people knowing the truth of a small group of unelected, unaccounted, private companies are running a deadly experiment on you and your families, without your consent or your knowledge.”

;

;Michelle Donelan, the UK technology secretary, said in advance of the conference: “The risks posed by frontier AI are serious and substantive and it is critical that we work together, both across sectors and countries to recognise these risks.

;

;“This summit provides an opportunity for us to ensure we have the right people with the right expertise gathered around the table to discuss how we can mitigate these risks moving forward. Only then will we be able to truly reap the benefits of this transformative technology in a responsible manner.”

;

;The UK government is also keen to emphasise the positive potential uses for AI. During the summit ministers will promise to spend £38m to help fund “safe and responsible” AI projects in poorer parts of the world, starting with Africa.

;

;Officials say one of the main aims of the summit is to persuade those at the forefront of developing AI technology to slow down their efforts to build the most sophisticated models.

;

;However, Clegg's comments suggest that is likely to be a difficult challenge.

;

;“I'm nonetheless still a sufficiently old-fashioned liberal to worry about the dead hand of the state,” he said.

;

;“In this area, it is really important to allow innovators, builders – people who are ingenious in the way in which they ultimately entrepreneurially develop these technologies – to do so without immediately assuming that whatever they do next is going to pose some existential risk.”

; Wed, 01 Nov 2023 08:52:02 +0800 Hong Kong: over-the-top punishment for 2019 democracy protesters, report findshttps://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/nov/01/hong-kong-over-the-top-punishment-for-2019-democracy-protesters-report-finds
;;2023-11-01T00:25:26Z;
;
;;People attend a protest held by civil servants in the Central District of Hong Kong on 2 August 2019, in opposition to a planned extradition law that quickly evolved into a wider movement for democratic reforms
;

;Protesters involved in the 2019-2020 pro-democracy movement in ;Hong Kong; have been treated extraordinarily harshly by the criminal justice system compared with local and international norms, a ;report; has found.

;

;The surge in ;arrests, detentions and charges; in the wake of the anti-extradition bill protests that saw millions of Hongkongers taking to the streets to oppose closer ties with mainland China meant that the criminal justice system was put under “extreme stress”, according to Jun Chan, Eric Yan-ho Lai and Thomas E Kellogg at the Center for Asian Law of Georgetown University.

;

;“In nearly all respects, the post-2019 response has on average been more punitive than prior responses to social movements, particularly the 2014 umbrella movement,” the authors said.

;
;

;;Related: ;;The mass protest decade: why did the street movements of the 2010s fail?;

;
;

;As of August 2022, more than 10,000 Hongkongers had been arrested in connection with the 2019 protest movement and nearly 3,000 prosecuted, according to government statistics. The Georgetown researchers analysed more than 1,500 cases that had concluded by 31 July 2021.

;

;Protesters were charged with 100 different types of offences.其中包括非法集会、骚乱、警察阻碍和袭击警察。超过 80% 的被定罪者被判处监禁，而因雨伞运动相关指控被定罪的人只有 31% 多一点。 The most common charge in the dataset was unlawful assembly, a colonial-era ordinance that allows the authorities to prosecute peaceful protesters.

;

;The anti-extradition bill protests lasted for more than six months in 2019-2020, much longer than the umbrella movement in 2014. They were ultimately defeated in June 2020 by the imposition of a draconian ;national security law (NSL); that effectively banned all forms of dissent and carries a maximum of a life sentence. The Chinese and Hong Kong authorities said the law was needed to restore stability.

;

;As of September, 280 people had been arrested under the NSL, including high profile figures such as the activist Joshua Wong and the former media proprietor ;Jimmy Lai;. These cases are tried in separate courts, with judges hand-picked by the executive.

;

;But most of the people swept into the criminal justice system after the protests have been charged with more ordinary offences, with many detained for several months in pre-trial detention.

;

;Between 2019 and 2021, the average waiting time for criminal trials increased by 50%, to 287 days, well beyond the official target of 100 days. “Such long wait times suggest that the court system is flailing under the weight of a massively increased caseload,” the report said.

;

;More than 130 of the defendants in the cases analysed by the researchers were under 18, with the median age being 23. More than 66% of juvenile convictions resulted in custodial sentences, which the researchers describe as “an extraordinarily high rate of incarceration for children”.

;

;By comparison, In England and Wales, 5% of juveniles who received criminal convictions in 2021 were put in custody.

;

;Open displays of dissent in Hong Kong are; now exceedingly rare;. In March, a small protest about a land reclamation plan took place under close police monitoring, the first time that any kind of demonstration had been allowed since 2020.

;

;John Lee, the city's chief executive, has said that introducing another Hong Kong national security law, in addition to the one imposed by Beijing in 2020, is a priority for 2024.
